relevant_findings.heent: Sclera anicteric, dry MM, oropharynx clear
relevant_findings.neck: Supple, JVP not elevated, no LAD
relevant_findings.lungs: Decreased at the bases, otherwise clear to auscultation bilaterally, no wheezes, rales, or rhonchi
relevant_findings.cardiovascular: Regular rate and rhythm, normal S1 S2, no murmurs, rubs, or gallops
relevant_findings.abdomen: Firm abdomen, tender diffusely most notably in the epigastrum and LUQ, no bowel sounds, evidence of guarding and rebound tenderness
relevant_findings.extremities: Warm, well perfused, 2+ pulses, no clubbing, cyanosis or edema

relevant_findings.mental_status: Somnolent and unable to provide history, significantly different from baseline
relevant_findings.peripheral_edema: Baseline peripheral edema, which is much improved currently
relevant_findings.vomiting: Episode of vomiting with complaint of abdominal pain

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Her mental status changed significantly from her baseline due to acute illness; peripheral edema improved.
